com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface getPossibleSchedules

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface getPossibleSchedules

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getPossibleSchedules(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getPossibleSchedules API retrieves any available schedules for an order or a line based on node and date.

    • Method Detail

      • getPossibleSchedules

        org.w3c.dom.Document getPossibleSchedules(YFSEnvironment env,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                   throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                          java.rmi.RemoteException

        The getPossibleSchedules API retrieves any available schedules for an order or a line based on node and date.

        The scheduling process determines the node to source an order or order line from. It also determines the date on which the order or order line can be sourced from a given node. The getPossibleSchedules API retrieves schedules based on the possible combinations of nodes, dates and substitutes that can be used to source an order. From the possible combinations, the system determines the best schedule based on various constraints, such as scheduling rule, optimization type, line dependencies, substitute type and kit lines, and suggests that it be used.

        For provided service and delivery service lines, the time slots that determine when a provided service can be performed or a delivery can be made are returned. These time slots belong to only one time zone and are returned across the resource pools that satisfy the input criteria based on the sourcing rule cofiguration. Slots which cannot be used for appointment planning will not be used for finding the possible options.
        An option will not be returned for Dynamic Physical Kit item associated with Delivery Service item while inquiring for appointment availability. Currently this functionality is not supported. If the carrier passed in the input or on the line is not in the routing guide as an option, no SCAC will be returned in the output.
        If there are pending changes on the order, they will be applied first internally, prior to evaluation of this API.
        For more details on sourcing, refer to ScheduleOrder api.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatability: No

        Integration with Inventory Visibility (phase 2.0) enabled:
        Features not supported in IV- availability by tag, segment, items with variation, GTIN, VMI, time-sensitive breakdown, multi-brand won't be supported.
        User exits com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetExternalSupplyUE, com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE, com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetDemandCorrectionsUE won't be supported with IV integration.
        Instead of reading supplies and demands from IV, node availability api of IV shall be invoked and the availabilities at node/s will be modelled as supplies.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the possible schedules. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
